reviews.review_msg: Martin is by far the best professor at SFU. The project you create in this class is relevant and something you could add to your resume. Readings - don't bother, and in lecture he just talks about current events and the history of PR - very interesting. LOVE HIM. TAKE THIS COURSE. SO INSPIRING.

Dr. Laba is definitely passionate and cares a lot about his students. He's interesting to listen to but I felt like the course didn't have a clear course plan/trajectory. We talked about politics or other topics a lot, the readings felt irrelevant to me. I like Martin but in terms of actual learning, I didn't gain much in this class.

Martin might be my favourite prof at SFU. His lectures are engaging - he encourages students to weigh in and he'll love you if you participate. The class deals with real social issues in a hands-on way, creating campaigns and giving presentations. He cares about his students and wants you to succeed. I've enjoyed all of my classes with him.

Martin is an interesting professor. The class was interesting because the entire semester was centered around a group project. His lectures are kind of long-winded and rant-y, and he has a really narrow view on certain things. So really his lectures are blastings of his own beliefs and views. He's okay I guess.

Professor Martin Laba is an excellent professor. He is charming, funny, and well-informed about the materials he is teaching. He cares about his students, and he is easy to talk to. Great class to take and listen. Listen and be engaged is the key.

Martin's an incredible lecturer who's super passionate about the topic. His project is really a "you have to try very hard to fail" type of deal - he even said it himself in the first couple classes. Readings are optional but they do help. Likes to mention the topics of HIV/AIDS a bit frequently but that's his subject area. Cares about students!

Okay so Martin is great. He keeps you calm when you approach him mid-semester and mid-breakdown. He is full of positive feedback but will nudge you in the right direction if you go off track. I entered the class secretly wanting to hate him - who is that well respected and deserves every bit of it? I left in admiration. Good guy/Great prof!

He does what he is passionate about in the world. In the classroom, he makes sure everyone knows how important his job outside the classroom is. It was interesting at first, but becomes boring and irrelevant to the course material. But your effort shows in your marks. He has favourites in his class too.

Martin is a genious, he is incredibly current and knows about everything.  Anyone who claims that he says the same things all the time obviously isn't listening.  Best prof I have had in my vast experience at SFU.

Laba is a PHONY. A good speaker, alright, but he's so darned arrogant and highly egotistic. And whoever said he's "genuinely" concerned with hs students...hah, wait until you actually get to KNOW him (like if you ever take his upper div classes). Eventually, you'll realize, he doesn't give a DAMN!
Sweet prof. Deserved his award yet can be a bit into himself at times...Cute
The brillance of Gary  reminds me of why I am in  univeristy in the first place.  I love him.  I love his classes. If you go through a CMNS major without Gary you are a fool.

Your grade for 85% of the class is based on a group project that spans the entire semester, which is great as long as you choose wisely who will be in your group (which you decide in the 2nd week). Not much direction is given for the projects, which means if you don't ask you're likely not going to do well. Be prepared to work.
Greatest prof ever. Actually talks WITH students in lecture, instead of AT them. Totally changing the way I see the world.
He literally changed my life, and the way I see academia.  Anyone who hasn't experienced one of his classes is missing out - BIG TIME.
The best prof at SFU..he is incredible!
This guy is a complete beauty. Helps you with the work, good sense of humor, and frequents the pub for post-class brews. Mike's legit.
Imagines himself "kewl" but is actually a narrow-minded narcissist. He has no idea.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Great prof, very inspiring. kewl dude all around who doesn't mind hanging with his students after class.
